business.headline: Bajaj Finance shares rally over 3% to reach record high, analysts bullishShares of the non-banking financial company rose 3.5% in early trade to reach a day's high of 9,070. At around 10:35 am, shares of the company were trading 2.43% higher at Rs 8,891.15 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
RVNL shares rise 4% as railway PSU bags Rs 555 crore project. Check detailsThe shares of RVNL were trading 4.18% higher at Rs 373 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

This woman earned $350 million a day but lost $3.6 billion in 3 daysMarina Bumdiman had accumulated a fortune of $7.5 billion, making her the richest woman in Indonesia. However, the rapid rise was followed by an equally sharp fall. In just three days, her net worth was cut in half, wiping out $3.6 billion.

Ola Electric shares jump over 6% after clarification on February sales dataOla Electric Mobility's share price rose over 6% on the Bombay Stock Exchange in early trade after an important clarification.

Accenture revenue forecast hits IT stocks, Infosys, Wipro fallAccenture, which is seen as a key indicator for the Indian IT sector, raised the lower end of its annual revenue forecast but kept the upper end unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag markets down after 4-day rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 98.30 points to 76,249.76, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 21.85 points to 23,168.80 as of 9:25 am.

Ola Electric explains February sales mismatch: Temporary backlog in registrationsOla Electric addressed concerns about the mismatch in a stock exchange filing, saying that daily registrations have now exceeded 50% of its three-month daily sales average.

Sensex, Nifty opening predictions on March 21: What to expect todayBSE, NSE today: Nifty has posted gains for four straight sessions this week, marking its longest winning streak in nearly seven weeks.

Stocks to watch on March 21: TCS, HUL, Zomato, Adani Enterprises, Jio FinancialSeveral stocks will be in focus today due to recent developments. These include Hindustan Unilever (HUL), Jio Financial, Adani Enterprises, Infosys, TCS, Bajaj Finance, Zomato, and others.

Planning taxes for FY2026? Which regime to pick- old or new?The old tax regime offers over 70 deductions and exemptions, including HRA, LTA, Section 80C, 80D, home loan interest, and education loan interest. Meanwhile, the new tax regime has simplified slabs but does not offer these deductions.

US stock market opening: Wall Street opens lower as tariff concerns resurfaceDarden Restaurants Inc. was the biggest gainer, climbing by 6.52%, at the opening bell. Others in the green zone included Jabil Inc., up by 4.09%, Solventum Corp., which rose by 2.41% and TransDigm Group Inc., which climbed by 2.15%.

EPFO speeds up claim processing, 60% settled via automated systemTo further quicken the process, EPFO has automated claims related to medical emergencies, housing, studies, and marriage costs. With this system in place, claims are now processed within just three days.

Daughter's future? Which is better- Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana or ELSS?SSY offers 8.2% as an annual interest rate. Investors can invest a minimum of Rs 250, while the maximum limit is Rs 1.5 lakh per year. Further, this scheme allows tax benefits under Sector 80C of the Income Tax Act 1961.

Money after divorce: How courts calculate alimonyAlimony in India does not follow a fixed formula. Courts consider various factors such as the financial position of both spouses, their earning potential, and their contributions to the marriage.

Jio Financial, Allianz likely reach deal for insurance joint venture in India: ReportJio Financial Services has reached an initial deal for a joint venture with Allianz SE to form an insurance business in India.
Sensex ends 900 points higher, Nifty over 23,100; Airtel gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 899.01 points to close at 76,348.06, while the NSE Nifty50 added 283.05 points to end at 23,190.65.

Worker regrets moving from Noida to Bengaluru for Rs 30,000 hike. Here's whyIn a recent social media post, a corporate employee described Bengaluru as "dirty, unorganised," with bad roads and the worst traffic. Apart from infrastructure issues, the worker also mentioned feeling a "north vs south" divide in everyday interactions.

Air India in talks to buy more widebody jets from Airbus and Boeing: ReportThe potential order is expected to be worth billions of dollars and could help the airline expand its long-haul fleet as it undergoes a major transformation under Tata Group ownership.

Sensex soars over 900 points: 3 factors behind stock market rallyShare market today: This week has been one of the best for Dalal Street this year. The S&P BSE Sensex surged 818.21 points to 76,267.26, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 254.50 points to 23,162.10 at 1:33 pm.

Boeing plane delays clip Akasa Air's wings, pilots left waiting: ReportAkasa is among many global airlines affected by Boeing's production issues, which have been worsened by regulatory scrutiny and a workers' strike.

Nithin Kamath's advice to investors amid market volatility : 'Cut your losers'Zerodha's Nithin Kamath shared an essential trading rule that is knowing when to exit a bad trade. Kamath explained that traders often hold on to losing positions, hoping they will recover. But instead of hoping, traders should act with caution and cut their losses early.

IndiGo shares soar after recent update, hit record high. Buy, sell or hold?In just 5 trading sessions, the stock has soared roughly 8%. IndiGo's stock is up over 10% this year and nearly 13% in a month. The latest jump in its share price came after the company recently shared its roadmap for FY30.

Adani group in $1.4 billion deal talks to buy Emaar's India business: ReportEmaar India has a strong presence in residential and commercial real estate across multiple states, including New Delhi, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan.

Government simplifies compounding rules, relaxes process for tax defaultersThe move aims to provide relief to taxpayers, to settle matters smoothly with the tax authorities and reduce unnecessary litigation.

Exiting foreign investors hurt Dalal Street rally, especially IT stocksContinued selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs), which persisted in the first half of March, could hurt market sentiment. FPIs mostly sold information technology (IT) and consumer goods stocks, with lingering concerns over the US and Indian economies.

Will US Fed's rate pause derail RBI's liquidity easing plans?With the US Fed on hold, will RBI ease further? After cutting the repo rate to 6.25% last month, the first in nearly five years, markets are watching for the central bank's next move.
Infosys, TCS, HCLTech gain up to 2%: Why are IT stocks rising today?IT sector stocks showcased strong performance in early trade with the Nifty IT index surging 1.56% as of 10 am.

TVS Motor shares rise as board to consider interim dividend today. Check detailsTVS Motor shares were trading marginally higher in early trade as investors await today's board meeting to consider an interim dividend for FY25.
Ola Electric share price falls after reports of regulatory scrutiny. Details hereOla Electric shares were trading 1.49% lower at Rs 53.02 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BS) at 9:53 am.
Sensex jumps 500 points: Why stock market is rising todayBSE, NSE today: By 10:52 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 396.37 points at 75,845.42, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 126.30 points to 23,033.90.
Sensex, Nifty rally in early trade as US Fed holds rates; IT stocks lead chargeThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 415.38 points to 75,864.43, while the NSE Nifty50 added 116.55 to 23,024.15 as of 9:24 am.
Ola Electric shares likely to be in focus today. Here's whyOla Electric Mobility's share price is down 38% this year, over 40% since listing, and 13% in a month.

Sensex, Nifty opening today: Will market react to US Fed interest rate decision?Sensex, Nifty today: Dalal Street is expected to react to the US Federal Reserve's decision to keep interest rates unchanged while maintaining its projection for rate cuts later this year.

Stocks to watch on March 20: Wipro, CEAT, Hyundai, Adani EnterprisesIn today's trading session, shares of Adani Enterprises, Wipro, Raymond, DMart, Trent, Hyundai Motor, NHPC, and others will be in focus due to key developments.

US Fed keeps interest rates unchanged: Key takeaways from the meetingThe Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) voted to keep interest rates unchanged, maintaining its benchmark rate in the range of 4.25-4.50%.
Ripple CEO claims US SEC to drop appeal against crypto firmRipple CEO, the company behind XRP, announced on X that the US Securities and Exchange Commission will drop its appeal against Ripple Labs.
Wall Street drifts higher ahead of Fed announcementUS stocks showed marginal gains on Wednesday morning as Wall Street waits for the Federal Reserve's announcement.

US markets rise ahead of key Fed interest rate decisionAt the opening bell, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 84.73 points to 41,666.04. The S&P 500 gained 18.29 points, reaching 5,632.95, while the Nasdaq Composite climbed 84.20 points to 17,588.32.
Government to continue footing the bill for UPI payments under Rs 2,000The scheme covers transactions up to Rs 2,000 and will be in place for one year, from April 1, 2024, to March 31, 2025.
India's first Trump-branded office project to be built in Pune. Check detailsOver the past decade, India has emerged as the largest international market for Trump-branded real estate.

entertainment.headline: Mahesh Babu's son Gautam performs mime at New York college, excited fans reactActor Mahesh Babu's son is studying dramatics at New York University. In a video shared by a fan-club, he is seen performing a mime with a girl. The video has now gone viral on social media.

Naga Chaitanya roasts Sobhita Dhulipala: You lack basic human skillsSobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya shared fun relationship insights, from who apologises first to who is more dramatic when sick. The couple got married in December 2024 in a traditional ceremony.

Mohanlal's Empuraan scripts history in pre-sales, set for a grand openingMohanlal's L2: Empuraan is taking the box office by storm in its pre-sales. According to initial reports, the film has grossed over Rs 12 crore only in the international market.

One Battle After Another teaser: Leonardo DiCaprio brings grit, gunfire in actionerThe teaser trailer of Paul Thomas Anderson's upcoming film with Leonardo DiCaprio was released. Titled One Battle After Another, the action-thriller is set for a September 2025 release.

Aamir Khan's family 'happy' about his relationship with Gauri, says sister NikhatAamir Khan's sister, Nikhat Hegde, said she is happy with his relationship with Gauri Spratt. She also praised Gauri and wished for the couple to stay happy forever.

Kanneda review: Parmish Varma is fantastic in gangster drama beyond guns and goons Released-Fri Mar 21, 2025'Kanneda' is a breath of fresh air in the Indian OTT scene. Singer and actor Parmish Verma bowls you over as an underdog-turned-drug-lord in the 90s 'Kanneda' of the Punjabi immigrants.

Adolescence highlights 'growing problem', must screen in schools: UK Prime MinisterThe UK Prime Minister, Keir Starmer, backed the call for screening Netflix's show Adolescence in schools. The four-part show sheds light on the growing influence of social media on teenage boys.

Adolescence was meant to be a why, not a whodunnit: Actor Stephen GrahamActor Stephen Graham discussed his latest Netflix series, Adolescence, on The Tonight Show. He highlighted how today's generation is exposed to all the information on social media, increasing social accountability. The Netflix series aims to spark a conversation on social influence.

Mahesh Babu's daughter Sitara teaches him Gen-Z lingo in their first collaborationMahesh Babu and his daughter Sitara appeared in their first-ever on-screen collaboration for a clothing brand. In the fun comercial, Sitara can be seen teaching Mahesh Babu Gen-Z words.

Chiranjeevi condemns unauthorised paid fan meets in UK, says no to exploitationMegastar Chiranjeevi warned his fans in United Kingdom about middlemen trying to charge them fees for fan meets. In a post on X, he condemned this behaviour and promised refunds.

Kendall Jenner criticizes Khloe Kardashian's 'cold' behavior towards Lamar OdomKendall Jenner criticized Khloe Kardashian's 'cold' and 'snarky' behavior during her reunion with Lamar Odom. She compared it to Khloe's treatment of Tristan Thompson and admitted she cried watching the episode.

Hollywood release shake-up: Warner Bros. reschedules major films for box office successWarner Bros. has rescheduled major releases, pushing The Bride to 2026 and One Battle After Another to September 2025. These moves aim to boost box office earnings and enhance awards season positioning.

Comedian Samay Raina postpones India tour amid India's Got Latent rowComedian Samay Raina shared a note in his Instagram stories, announcing that he has postponed his India tour. His decision comes weeks after he found himself in the middle of a controversy involving podcaster Ranveer Allahabadia's comments on his YouTube show, 'India's Got Latent'.

Lollapalooza 2025 lineup announced: Olivia Rodrigo, A$AP Rocky, and moreLollapalooza 2025's lineup includes Olivia Rodrigo, A$AP Rocky, Sabrina Carpenter, and Korn. The festival runs from July 31 and promises another exciting mix of top artists.

Khloé Kardashian reveals her beauty secretKhloé Kardashian revealed that she uses salmon sperm into her skincare routine. However, experts remain skeptical due to lack of scientific evidence, and the treatment is not FDA-approved.

Sobhita says she drives Naga Chaitanya 'crazy', reveals how they fell in loveActors Sobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya recently opened up about their sweet bond in a new interview, where they shared how their love story began. The couple got married last December.

Pics: Shaheer Sheikh visits Tirupati temple, reunites with Mahabharat co-starsActor Shaheer Sheikh recently visited the Tirupati temple with his Mahabharat co-stars. The actor donned a traditional outfit and his co-star, Thakur Anup Singh shared the photos.

Kendrick Lamar's label seeks to halt Drake's lawsuit over Not Like Us diss trackUniversal Music Group (UMG) seeks to pause the discovery process in Drake's lawsuit concerning Kendrick Lamar's diss track 'Not Like Us.' Drake's team argues against UMG's delay tactics.

Independent artistes Hanumankind, Diljit Dosanjh take Indian music global: ReportIn addition to Bollywood, independent Indian artistes are gaining significant recognition on the global music stage. Musicians such as Hanumankind, AP Dhillon, Diljit Dosanjh, and others are at the forefront of this movement, drawing a growing international audience.

general news.headline: Fire at Delhi judge's bungalow leads to huge cash recovery; he gets transferredJustice Yashwant Verma was sent back to his parent court following the recommendation of the Supreme Court Collegium after the incident came to light.

Meerut woman posed as lover's dead mother on Snapchat, said husband be killed: CopsIn a bizarre twist to the case, Muskan had created three fake Snapchat ID under the name of her brother. She used this account to send messages, convincing Sahil that his mother was speaking to him from the afterlife.

UK's Heathrow Airport closed for 24 hours after huge fire at power substationLondon's Heathrow Airport on Friday announced that it will remain shut for at least 24 hours after a fire at a nearby electrical substation caused a significant power outage. All arrival and departure flights to the airport have been cancelled.

Trump warns Tesla vandals could face 20 years in prison: We are looking for youFollowing a string of attacks on Tesla, US President Donald Trump on Friday warned that those targeting the automobile company could face up to twenty years in jail.

Can a parent's affair shape a child's emotional world?For a child who is in his teens or pre-teens and struggling with numerous things like puberty, peers, and relationships, the revelation of a parent's affair can be a blow big enough to shape how the person grows up emotionally.

Passenger found dead on Air India flight after plane lands in LucknowThe Air India passenger had not unfastened his seatbelt, indicating that he had died midair. The exact cause of death will be ascertained after postmortem, police said.

Judge blocks Trump move to deport Indian student over alleged Hamas linkThe Department of Homeland Security has accused Badar Khan Suri of ties to the Palestinian militant group Hamas and said he had spread Hamas propaganda and antisemitism on social media.

Trump signs executive order aimed at dismantling Department of EducationTrump signed an executive order to dismantle the US Department of Education, shifting control to states, but full closure requires Congress's approval.

His decision comes weeks after he found himself in the middle of a controversy involving podcaster Ranveer Allahabadia's comments on his YouTube show, 'India's Got Latent'.

Report shows Karnataka leads with country's richest MLAs amid salary hike rowA report by Association for Democratic Reforms shows that Karnataka leads India with 31 billionaire MLAs, followed by Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra. Despite having the wealthiest MLAs, the  Congress-led government has proposed a bill to give hefty salary and allowance hikes to the legislators.

India submits bid to host 2030 Commonwealth Games: Sports Ministry SourcesIndia submitted the bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games on Thursday, March 20. It's a major step towards achieving India's dream of hosting the 2036 Summer Olympic Games in Ahmedabad.

Bengaluru techie levels cash-for-intimacy charge, wife alleges domestic abuseA Bengaluru techie accused his wife of harassment over financial demands and physical abuse. His wife filed a counter-complaint alleging domestic violence and dowry harassment. The police summoned both for questioning to look into the matter.

One Battle After Another teaser: Leonardo DiCaprio brings grit, gunfire in actionerThe teaser trailer of Paul Thomas Anderson's upcoming film with Leonardo DiCaprio was released. Titled One Battle After Another, the action-thriller is set for a September 2025 release.

How Indian personal care market is making even better business senseNewer growth areas, such as serums, hair masks, mists and facial oils, lead the charge as consumers get more self-aware and discretionary spending rises

People in war-torn Ukraine and Palestine are happier than Indians: ReportAre you happy? Do the people around you seem happy? While this question might invite deep reflection, the answer to personal happiness often boils down to a simple 'Yes' or 'No.' The 2025 World Happiness Report is out and Finland has topped the list. Check out India's ranking.

Armaan and I are one: Singer Amaal Mallik after deleting 'breaking family ties' postSinger Amaal Mallik talked about his struggle with clinical depression in a now-deleted social media post. He announced in the same post that he was breaking ties with his family. However, he later mentioned that his relationship with his brother, Armaan Malik, is fine.

How Sambhaji Maharaj's 9-year struggle doomed Aurangzeb and the Mughal empire's fallCrowned as the Chhatrapati of Marathas in 1681 after Shivaji's death, Sambhaji Maharaj did not merely inherit the throne, but the smouldering legacy of Swarajya. Sensing weakness, the Mughals kept doggedly pursuing him, and he was captured after nine years of resistance. Sambhaji endured 40 days of savage torture at the hands of Aurangzeb, but still, he would neither surrender nor convert.

100% salary hike for Chief Minister, legislators: Inside Karnataka draft billIndia Today has exclusively accessed the Karnataka Legislature Salaries, Pensions, and Allowances (Amendment) Bill, 2025, which proposes significant salary hikes for legislators, ministers, and Assembly officials.

Trump's top aide backs Israeli strikes on Gaza that broke 2-month ceasefireThe Donald Trump administration has firmly backed Israel's decision to resume fighting on Monday night after Hamas rejected a US offer to extend the first phase of the hostage deal.

Karnataka Minister claims 48 politicians, including central leaders, honey trappedKarnataka Minister KN Rajanna made an explosive claim in the Assembly about 48 politicians, including central leaders, being victims of honey traps. This triggered a political storm, with demands for a high-level investigation.

Sonakshi Sinha on life with Zaheer Iqbal: Haven't wasted a day since I met himSonakshi Sinha shared a heart-warming 'husband appreciation post' for Zaheer Iqbal, calling him her source of laughter. The couple got married in June 2024.

sports.headline: R Ashwin meets D Gukesh at Chepauk, plays chess with world championIPL 2025: R Ashwin gave D Gukesh a CSK jersey and also played chess with the youngest world champion. Ashwin has returned to playing for CSK since last playing for them way back in 2015.

Forget the past, believe in yourself: Sreesanth backs Umran to bounce backIPL 2025: S Sreesanth, speaking to IndiaToday.in, urged young fast bowlers, including Umran Malik, to prioritise fitness, smart training, and recovery for sustained success. Backing Umran to make a strong comeback from injury setbacks, the former fast bowler urged young pacers in the country to believe they can win matches for India.

Suryakumar Yadav's Mumbai Indians reach Chennai before CSK clashIPL 2025: Suryakumar Yadav's Mumbai Indians (MI) reached Chennai on Thursday night before their opening game against five-time champions Chennai Super Kings on March 23 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.

BCCI abolishes rule of banning captains for over-rate offencesIPL 2025: The BCCI did away with the rule of banning captains for over-rate offences with the decision being taken in the captains' meeting at the BCCI headquarters in Mumbai on Thursday.

Fans enjoy Virat Kohli's batting session before curtain raiserIPL 2025: RCB veteran Virat Kohli practised wholeheartedly at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata before the tournament opener as the fans enjoyed watching him bat in the training session.

Will KKR captain Ajinkya Rahane silence doubters in new season?KKR decided to take the bold call of having Ajinkya Rahane as their skipper for the new season. With many doubting his credentials, can Rahane silence his critics and lead KKR to glory?

NBA: Boston Celtics set for record-breaking $6.1 billion saleOn Thursday, reigning NBA champions, the Boston Celtics announced plans of a $6.1 billion sale to a private equity firm. If approved, this would be the most expensive team sale in North America.

PCB says no monetary loss in Champions Trophy, claims USD 10 million profitPakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has refuted claims of monetary loss after hosting the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 and said that it earned approximately USD 10 million as profit.

The Warriors' injury report seems favourable as they prepare for an epic battle except Gary Payton II who is uncertain due to a knee injury.

Virat bhai supported me a lot, was emotional to leave RCB: Mohammed SirajIndia fast bowler Mohammed Siraj said that it was emotional for him to leave Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) after playing with Virat Kohli for seven years, who supported him a lot.

Carlos Alcaraz caught off guard by PTPA lawsuit, says he doesn't support itThe PTPA, an advocacy group established by Novak Djokovic and Vasek Pospisil, filed the lawsuit on Tuesday accusing the ATP, WTA, International Tennis Federation and International Tennis Integrity Agency of anti-competitive practices.

Exclusive: Sreesanth motivates injury-prone Umran Malik with special messageIPL 2025: Speaking to India Today, JioStar expert and former pacer Sreesanth urged Umran Malik to work smarter to recover from injury setbacks and return to action. Umran, who was signed by Kolkata Knight Riders, was ruled out of IPL 2025 due to an injury.

April 6 match between KKR and LSG to shift from Kolkata to GuwahatiIPL 2025: The April 6 game between Kolkata Knight Riders and Lucknow Super Giants will be shifted from Kolkata to Guwahati. The decision was taken after Kolkata Police informed the state cricket body that it wouldn't be able to provide adequate security for the game, which coincides with Ram Navami festivities.

IPL 2025: Rain to play spoilsport in season opener between RCB and KKR in KolkataThe opening game of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) is in danger of being washed out as heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are likely to interrupt the game.

S Sreesanth praises Riyan Parag on his ascent to captaincy after prolific 2024 seasonFormer India fast bowler S Sreesanth praised Riyan Parag on being appointed as the captain of the Rajasthan Royals (RR) for the first three matches of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

IPL captains' meet: Pat Cummins odd man out in photoshoot near Gateway of IndiaIPL 2025: Pat Cummins and Shreyas Iyer took centrestage during the customary captains' photoshoot in Mumbai on Thursday. The new season will get underway in Kolkata on March 22.

NBA: Michael Malone fires back at criticism over Jokić, Murray's absenceDenver Nuggets head coach Michael Malone did not hold back after ESPN's Tim Bontemps criticized the team for sitting Nikola Jokić and Jamal Murray during the regular NBA game against the Golden State Warriors.

Watch: Abhishek Sharma warms up for IPL 2025 by breaking glasses in Hyderabad stadiumIndia and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) opener Abhishek Sharma broke the glass at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad while practising for the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Watch: Yuzvendra Chahal wears 'be your own sugar daddy' T-shirt to divorce hearingIndia cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal was seen wearing a T-shirt with a message that read 'be your own sugar daddy' during his divorce plea hearing at a family court in Mumbai on Thursday.

IPL 2025 New Rule Explained: 2 balls to be used in evening matches to counter dewThe Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) is set to introduce two new balls for the matches played in the evening to counter the dew factor.

BCCI lifts saliva ban in landmark post-Covid move after captains' approvalThe Board of Control for Cricket India (BCCI) has lifted the ban on the usage of saliva on balls during matches in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025, the first time since the law was enforced in 2020 during the Covid-19 pandemic.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
